classmeta.shortdesc: A window which will likely contain the rest of the application.

desc.simpara: A window is the framework that contains the application. It provides a context for the other widgets that make up the application.

As a subclass of GtkBin a window may only have one child. To add more widgets to a window first add a widget which can accept more than one child like a GtkHBox or a GtkVBox. Then add the other widgets to the child container. Trying to add more than one child will produce a warning.

example.title: Adding too many children.
example.programlisting:
<?php
// Create a new window.
$window = new GtkWindow();

// Add two buttons.
$window->add(new GtkButton('1'));
$window->add(new GtkButton('2'));

/*
Spits out:
Gtk-WARNING **: Attempting to add a widget with type GtkButton to 
a GtkWindow, but as a GtkBin subclass a GtkWindow can only 
contain one widget at a time; it already contains a widget 
of type GtkButton
*/
?>

desc.simpara: GtkWindow is a top level widget. This means that it may not be added as a child of another widget. Trying to do so will produce a Gtk-WARNING.

Creates a new instance of GtkWindow of type type. If no type is passed, the window will be created as a GTK::WINDOW_TOPLEVEL. This means that the window will have borders and a title bar by default. Windows of type GTK::WINDOW_POPUP will not have borders or a title bar. Popup windows are used for things such as tooltips and menus. They should not be used to create regular windows without borders. For that you should use a toplevel window and set_decorated.

method.shortdesc: Deiconifies (unminimizes) the window.

desc.simpara: Asks the window manager to deiconify (to un-minimize) the window.
desc.note: It may be that there are some settings preventing this, so don't depend on that it is really unminimized after calling this function. Normally it is, but don't write code that crashes if not.

method.shortdesc: Sets the window to fullscreen mode.

desc.simpara: Asks the window manager to set the window to fullscreen, taking all the available space. Note that other windows on the screen may still be above as long as the window is not activated. To be sure the window is really fullscreen, activate it.
desc.note: It may be that there are some settings preventing this, so don't depend on that it is really fullscreen after calling this function. Normally it is, but don't write code that crashes if not.

method.shortdesc: If the window has a frame border.

desc.simpara: Tells you if the window has a border or is borderless.

method.shortdesc: If the window is modal or not.

desc.simpara: Tells you if the window is modal.
Modal windows prevent user interaction with other windows of the same application.

method.shortdesc: Returns nothing. This method should probably be removed from the documentation.
If the window can be resized by the user.

desc.simpara: Tells you if the user may resize the window.

method.shortdesc: If a pager shall display the window.

desc.simpara: Tells you if a pager shall display the window.

method.shortdesc: If the window shall be hidden from the task bar.

desc.simpara: Tells you if the window shall be hidden fron the task bar. Even if it's not shown in the task bar, it still may be shown in the window list when doing an ALT+TAB.

method.shortdesc: Minimizes the window.

desc.simpara: Minimizes (iconifies) the window.
desc.note: It may be that there are some settings preventing this, so don't depend on that it is really minimized after calling this function. Normally it is, but don't write code that crashes if not.

method.shortdesc: Maximizes the window.

desc.simpara: Tells the window manager to maximize the window. If it's maximized, it takes all the available space which is not occupied by extra windows like e.g. the task bar.
desc.note: It may be that there are some settings preventing this, so don't depend on that it is really fullscreen after calling this function. Normally it is, but don't write code that crashes if not.

method.shortdesc: Shows the window to the user.

desc.simpara: Activates and shows the window to the user. If it was hidden, it's shown. If the window has been overlapped by other windows, it will be raised to the top. If it was minimized, it will be unminimized.

The method is useful to show a window which already exists, e.g. when there is a "Show preferences" menu item in your application, but the preferences dialog is already open, but hidden somewhere. In that case you should use this function.

method.shortdesc: Turns the borders and title bar for the window on/off.
Forces the window to remain on top of other windows on the screen.

desc.simpara: Tells the window manager to keep the window above all other windows.
desc.note: It may be that there are some settings preventing this, so don't depend on that it is really above every other window after calling this function. Normally it is, but don't write code that crashes if not.
desc.simpara: See also: set_keep_below

method.shortdesc: Forces the window to remain beneath other windows on the screen.

desc.simpara: Tells the window manager to keep the window below all other windows.
desc.note: It may be that there are some settings preventing this, so don't depend on that it is really below all other windows after calling this function. Normally it is, but don't write code that crashes if not.
desc.simpara: See also: set_keep_above

method.shortdesc: Sets the window modal.

desc.simpara: Sets the window modal, preventing user interaction with any other window of the same application.
A window should be set modal if it requires user interaction before the rest of the application can continue, e.g. a message box.

method.shortdesc: Sets if the window may be resized by the user.

desc.simpara: Sets if the user may resize window or not.

method.shortdesc: Hide the window from the pager or not.

desc.simpara: If the window shall not be shown in the pager.

note.simpara: A pager is a program showing the contents (windows) of each virtual desktop, in small scale, to help the user get an overview of all the desktops and its open applications.
Users of Microsoft Windows rarely have multiple desktops and probably don't care about this setting.

method.shortdesc: Set that the window shall be hidden from the task bar.

desc.simpara: If the window shall not be shown in the task bar. Note that even though the window is not shown in the task bar, it still may be visible in the window list when ALT+TABing through the windows.

method.shortdesc: Sets the window title

desc.simpara: Sets the window title.

method.shortdesc: Show the window on all desktops.

desc.simpara: Shows the window on all (virtual) desktops.

method.shortdesc: Returns the window to its original size and location.

desc.simpara: If the window has been set to be fullscreen, it's returned to its original size and location.

method.shortdesc: Returns the window to its original size and location.

desc.simpara: If the window has been set to be maximized, it's returned to its original size and location.

method.shortdesc: Don't show the window on all desktops.

desc.simpara: Don't show the window on all (virtual) desktops.
